column1: no knowledge of the offence being committed.
As  mentioned  earlier  in  Atapattu  Mudiyanselage  Sadi  Banda  and  3  others  vs.  Officer-in-
Charge, Police Station, Norton Bridge CA(PHC) 03/2013, dated 25.07.2014;
“I am of the view, before making the Order of confiscation learned Magistrate should
have taken into consideration, value of the timber transported, no allegations prior to
this incident that the lorry had been used for any illegal purpose, that the appellant
and the accused are habitual offenders in this nature and no previous convictions, and
the acceptance of the fact that the Appellant did not have any knowledge about the
transporting of timber without a permit. On these facts the Court is of the view that
the confiscation of the lorry is not justifiable,”
